case_title: Qadir, MemberIFTIKHAR HUSSAIN ABBAS-I vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU AND KASHMIR
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondent: Azad Government of the State of Jammu and Kashmir

misconduct: Issuance of Government Order No. 538-40/76 dated 8-1-1976 sanctioning payment of Rs. 15,000 out of Auqaf Fund.
Issuance of Government Order No. Admin/11054-54/76 dated 17-4-76 sanctioning payment of Rs. 40,000 out of Auqaf Fund.
Failure to obtain concurrence of Finance Department and approval of the Prime Minister before issuance of orders.

laws_referenced: Azad Jammu & Kashmir Civil Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1977
Azad Jammu and Kashmir Waqaf Properties Act, 1960
Azad Jammu and Kashmir Waqaf Properties Account Rules, 1961
Azad Jammu and Kashmir Interim Constitution Act, 1974

key_findings.finance_department_concurrence: Not required as the funds were from Auqaf Fund, not Government Finance.
key_findings.prime_minister_approval: Necessary before issuance of orders under Rules of Business, 1975.
key_findings.misconduct_proven: Appellant issued orders without prior approval of Prime Minister.

punishment.tribunal_decision: Punishment deemed excessive; lenient view recommended.

special_circumstances: Payments were recommended by high-ranking officials.
Urgency of medical treatment for beneficiary.
Appellant had limited experience in secretariat service.
